_comment: CUI // SP-CTI — ICDEV Capability Catalog for GovCon Requirement Mapping (D363)

capabilities.name: DevSecOps CI/CD Pipeline
capabilities.description: Automated 9-step DevSecOps pipeline with syntax validation, linting, unit tests, BDD, SAST, E2E testing, vision validation, acceptance gates, and security/compliance gates. 5 maturity levels (Initial to Optimizing).
capabilities.evidence: Phase 24 DevSecOps, 9-step testing pipeline, 5 maturity levels, Kyverno/OPA policy generation, image attestation

capabilities.name: ATO Automation & Continuous Authorization
capabilities.description: Automated ATO artifact generation (SSP, POAM, STIG checklists, SBOM), continuous ATO monitoring with evidence freshness tracking, OSCAL generation/validation, eMASS synchronization.
capabilities.evidence: 42 compliance frameworks, dual-hub crosswalk, OSCAL generation/validation/conversion, cATO monitoring with evidence freshness, eMASS sync

capabilities.name: AI/ML Governance & Responsible AI
capabilities.description: Comprehensive AI governance: NIST AI RMF assessment, model/system cards, AI inventory, fairness assessment, confabulation detection, GAO accountability evidence, OMB M-25-21/M-26-04 compliance, EU AI Act risk classification.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 48-50: 4 AI frameworks (NIST AI RMF, OMB M-25-21, OMB M-26-04, GAO-21-519SP), model/system cards, AI inventory, fairness assessment, confabulation detection, EU AI Act classifier

capabilities.name: Zero Trust Architecture
capabilities.description: 7-pillar ZTA maturity scoring (DoD ZTA Strategy), NIST 800-207 compliance assessment, service mesh generation (Istio/Linkerd), network segmentation, PDP/PEP configuration, cATO posture integration.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 25: 7-pillar maturity scoring, NIST 800-207 assessor, Istio/Linkerd service mesh, Kyverno/OPA policies, PDP/PEP config for Zscaler/DISA ICAM

capabilities.name: Cloud Migration & Modernization
capabilities.description: Legacy application modernization via 7R methodology, multi-cloud IaC generation (6 CSPs), containerization, Kubernetes deployment, framework migration, monolith decomposition, strangler fig tracking with ATO compliance bridge.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 38: 6 CSP support (AWS GovCloud, Azure Gov, GCP Assured, OCI Gov, IBM IC4G, local), Terraform generators per CSP, 7R assessment, strangler fig tracking, ATO compliance bridge

capabilities.name: Multi-Framework Compliance Automation
capabilities.description: 42 compliance frameworks with dual-hub crosswalk (NIST 800-53 US hub + ISO 27001 international hub). Implement a control once, cascade everywhere. Auto-detection from data categories, multi-regime assessment, unified gate evaluation.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 23: 42 frameworks, dual-hub crosswalk engine, BaseAssessor ABC pattern, auto-detection from 10 data categories, multi-regime deduplication

capabilities.name: Test-Driven Development & BDD
capabilities.description: True RED→GREEN→REFACTOR TDD cycle with BDD/Gherkin scenario generation. 6 first-class languages (Python, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, Go, Rust, C#). Automated test writing, code generation, linting, formatting.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 42: 6 first-class languages, language-specific build plans, 9-step testing pipeline, ATLAS/M-ATLAS workflow

capabilities.name: AI-Driven Requirements Intake (RICOAS)
capabilities.description: Conversational AI requirements intake with gap detection, SAFe decomposition (Epic→Capability→Feature→Story→Enabler), WSJF scoring, readiness scoring (7 dimensions), document extraction from SOW/CDD, ATO boundary impact analysis.
capabilities.evidence: RICOAS: 5-stage intake, 7-dimension readiness scoring, SAFe decomposition with BDD generation, document extraction, 4-tier ATO boundary impact

capabilities.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
capabilities.description: Dependency graph analysis, SBOM aggregation, ISA lifecycle management, NIST 800-161 SCRM vendor assessment, CVE triage with SLA enforcement, impact propagation analysis.
capabilities.evidence: Supply Chain Agent: dependency graph, ISA lifecycle, SCRM assessment, CVE triage with SLA, SBOM generation (CycloneDX)

capabilities.name: Digital Program Twin & Simulation
capabilities.description: 6-dimension what-if simulation (schedule, cost, risk, compliance, resource, quality), Monte Carlo estimation, Course of Action generation and comparison, scenario forking.
capabilities.evidence: Simulation Agent: 6-dimension engine, Monte Carlo (stdlib random, air-gap safe), 3+alternative COA generation, scenario comparison

capabilities.name: Multi-Agent Orchestration
capabilities.description: 15-agent architecture with DAG-based task decomposition, parallel execution, domain authority vetoes, agent collaboration patterns (reviewer, debate, ensemble), agent memory and mailbox.
capabilities.evidence: 15 agents, 3 tiers, A2A JSON-RPC 2.0 over mTLS, DAG workflows, domain authority vetoes, agent memory scoped by project

capabilities.name: Model-Based Systems Engineering
capabilities.description: SysML/UML model import (XMI/ReqIF), digital thread traceability (N:M links), model-to-code generation, drift detection and sync, DoDI 5000.87 DES compliance, PI-snapshot versioning.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 18: XMI/ReqIF parsing, N:M digital thread, model-code generation (6 languages), drift detection, DES compliance, PI-snapshot versioning

capabilities.name: Proactive Monitoring & Self-Healing
capabilities.description: Heartbeat daemon with configurable health checks, auto-resolution pipeline (confidence-based), SSE dashboard alerts, SIEM forwarding, knowledge base pattern detection, self-healing with rate limits.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 29: heartbeat daemon, 3-tier auto-resolution, SSE alerts, SIEM forwarding, knowledge base self-healing

capabilities.name: Comprehensive Security Scanning
capabilities.description: SAST (Bandit/language-specific), dependency vulnerability auditing, secret detection, container image scanning, prompt injection detection, AI telemetry, behavioral drift detection, ATLAS red teaming.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 37/45: 5-category prompt injection, AI telemetry, ATLAS red team (6 techniques), OWASP Agentic (8 gaps), behavioral drift z-score, tool chain validation

capabilities.name: CUI & Data Classification Management
capabilities.description: 10 data categories (CUI, PHI, PCI, CJIS, etc.) with composite marking support. Classification applied at generation time. FIPS 199/200 security categorization with SP 800-60 information types and CNSSI 1253 overlay.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 20/23: 10 data categories, composable markings, FIPS 199 high watermark, FIPS 200 17-area validation, CNSSI 1253 auto-overlay for IL6

capabilities.name: OSCAL Ecosystem & Interoperability
capabilities.description: OSCAL SSP/POAM/SAR/Profile generation, 3-layer deep validation (structural + pydantic + Metaschema via oscal-cli), format conversion, profile resolution, NIST catalog integration.
capabilities.evidence: D302-D306: oscal-cli integration, oscal-pydantic validation, NIST catalog adapter, 3-layer validation pipeline, format conversion

capabilities.name: FedRAMP 20x KSI Evidence
capabilities.description: FedRAMP 20x Key Security Indicator (KSI) evidence generation across 61 KSIs, authorization packaging (OSCAL SSP + KSI bundle), continuous monitoring evidence.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 53: 61 KSI evidence generation, OSCAL SSP + KSI bundle, FedRAMP Moderate/High baselines

capabilities.name: Code Quality Intelligence
capabilities.description: AST-based code analysis: cyclomatic/cognitive complexity, 5 smell detectors, deterministic maintainability scoring, runtime feedback (test-to-source correlation), trend tracking.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 52: AST metrics, 5 smell detectors, maintainability scoring (5-weight formula), runtime feedback, Innovation Engine integration

capabilities.name: Modular Open Systems Approach (MOSA)
capabilities.description: DoD MOSA (10 U.S.C. §4401) compliance: modularity analysis (coupling/cohesion/circular deps), ICD/TSP generation, code enforcement, cATO evidence integration.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 26: MOSA assessment, static analysis (coupling/cohesion/circular deps), ICD/TSP generation, code enforcement

capabilities.name: External Tool Integration
capabilities.description: Bidirectional sync with Jira, ServiceNow, GitLab. DOORS NG ReqIF export. Approval workflows. Full requirements traceability matrix (RTM).
capabilities.evidence: Phase integration: bidirectional Jira/ServiceNow/GitLab, DOORS NG ReqIF export, approval workflows, full RTM

capabilities.name: Distributed Tracing & Explainable AI
capabilities.description: OpenTelemetry-compatible distributed tracing, W3C PROV-AGENT provenance graph, AgentSHAP tool attribution (Shapley values), XAI compliance assessment. Dual-mode: OTel (production) or SQLite (air-gapped).
capabilities.evidence: Phase 46: OTel+SQLite dual-mode, W3C PROV-AGENT, AgentSHAP (0.945 consistency), XAI assessor (10 checks)

capabilities.name: Compliance Evidence Auto-Collection
capabilities.description: Universal evidence collection across 14 compliance frameworks. Freshness monitoring with configurable max-age. Heartbeat integration for automated collection.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 56: 14-framework evidence collection, freshness checking, heartbeat integration

capabilities.name: Cross-Language Code Translation
capabilities.description: 5-phase hybrid pipeline: Extract→Type-Check→Translate→Assemble→Validate+Repair. 30 language pairs, pass@k candidates, mock-and-continue, compliance bridge for NIST control inheritance.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 43: 30 language pairs, pass@k candidates, compiler-feedback repair, mock-and-continue, 95% control coverage bridge

capabilities.name: Web Dashboard & Visualization
capabilities.description: Flask SSR dashboard with 30+ pages, SVG charts (zero-dependency), real-time SSE updates, role-based views (5 roles), keyboard shortcuts, batch operations, onboarding tour. CUI banner support.
capabilities.evidence: 30+ dashboard pages, SVG charts.js, SSE live updates, 5-role RBAC, batch ops, keyboard shortcuts, CUI banners

capabilities.name: Infrastructure as Code Generation
capabilities.description: Multi-cloud Terraform generation (6 CSPs), Ansible playbooks, Kubernetes manifests, Helm charts, pipeline generation. STIG-hardened Docker containers. Auto-scaling (HPA/PDB).
capabilities.evidence: 6 CSP Terraform generators, Ansible, K8s manifests, Helm chart, STIG-hardened Dockerfiles, Iron Bank metadata, auto-scaling (HPA/PDB)

capabilities.name: Agile & SAFe Planning
capabilities.description: SAFe decomposition (Epic→Story), WSJF scoring, T-shirt sizing, sprint planning, PI tracking, spec quality checking, constitution-based validation, clarification engine.
capabilities.evidence: RICOAS decomposition, spec quality checker, constitution validation, clarification engine, parallel task detection

capabilities.name: Data Analytics & NLQ
capabilities.description: Natural language compliance queries (NLQ→SQL via LLM), read-only enforcement on audit tables, real-time event timeline (SSE), usage tracking and cost dashboard.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 40: NLQ→SQL via Bedrock, read-only enforcement, SSE event timeline, usage/cost dashboard

capabilities.name: OWASP Agentic AI Security
capabilities.description: 8-gap OWASP Agentic implementation: behavioral drift detection, tool chain validation, output content safety, dynamic trust scoring, MCP per-tool RBAC, behavioral red teaming, formal threat model (STRIDE + T1-T17).
capabilities.evidence: Phase 45: 8-gap implementation, z-score drift detection, sliding-window tool chain, trust scoring with decay/recovery, MCP RBAC (5 roles)

capabilities.name: Platform One / Iron Bank Hardening
capabilities.description: Iron Bank hardening manifest generation for Platform One Big Bang deployment. Base image selection, vulnerability scanning requirements, STIG overlay application.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 57: hardening manifest generation, base image registry, STIG overlay, language auto-detection

capabilities.name: AI Incident Response & Ethics
capabilities.description: AI incident logging and classification, ethics reviews, impact assessments, appeals process, CAIO designation, oversight plans, reassessment scheduling.
capabilities.evidence: Phase 49: incident log, ethics reviews, impact assessments, CAIO designation, oversight plans, appeals, reassessment scheduling
